intro: Lastrea chlamydophora, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in gardens with suitable conditions.
